page.title: 14PLAYGROUND GAMES,DRAYTON
page.content: There are a great number of games played in the play ground,most of which involve 1 child being{"It",}the person who calls the moves or who has to be beaten.The choice of "It" is done either by common consent or by a short race. There are many forms of{"He"}where one person has to catch others,who are then "It";in{"Bulldog"}those who are caught become catchers until only one child is left.Games like{"Pompom" involve the defence of a place against "attackers" who hide themselves until the last moment to avoid detection. There are also numerous games which involve{skipping ropes}as well as {elastic}stretched between the legs of two players.The games are too detailed to be explained fully, but all have origins dating back to the playgrounds of many years ago.
